p: Polyphenols are an important group of secondary metabolites widely distributed in the plant kingdom [ 29]. Plants produce phenolic structures, mostly flavonoids and tannins, phenolic acids, lignans, and stilbenes as a defense mechanism against UV-light, parasites, other pathogens, and herbivores. Some of these molecules are pigments, attracting pollinators and thus contributing to plant seedsâ€™ dispersion [ 3, 13]. When consumed as part of the diet, these compounds are important to protect enzymes; provide vitamins, taste, and color; and avoid lipid peroxidation [ 55], having great utility as functional ingredients.
